sections.instructions: Questions 21–25: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 26–30: Choose FIVE letters A–G.
sections.title: Planning a presentation on nanotechnology

questions.question: Russ says that his difficulty in planning the presentation is due to
options: A his lack of knowledge about the topic
B his uncertainty about what he should try to achieve
C the short time that he has for preparation

questions.question: Russ and his tutor agree that his approach in the presentation will be
options: A to concentrate on how nanotechnology is used in one field
B to follow the chronological development of nanotechnology
C to show the range of applications of nanotechnology

questions.question: In connection with slides, the tutor advises Russ to
options: A talk about things that he can find slides to illustrate
B look for slides to illustrate the points he makes

questions.question: They both agree that the best way for Russ to start his presentation is
options: A to encourage the audience to talk
B to explain what Russ intends to do

questions.question: What does the tutor advise Russ to do next while preparing his presentation?
options: A summarise the main point he wants to make
B read the notes he has already made
C list the topics he wants to cover
